meanings.definition: To dry (something) before further drying is required.
meanings.sent1: I always predry my clothes before putting them in the dryer.
meanings.sent2: The recipe said to predry the mushrooms before cooking them.
meanings.sent3: The chef forgot to predry the lettuce and ended up with a soggy salad.
meanings.sent4: She predried her hair with a towel before using the hairdryer.
meanings.sent5: The painter predried the canvas to ensure the paint would adhere properly.

meanings.definition: The act of drying something before further drying is required.
meanings.sent1: Predrying is an important step in the manufacturing process.
meanings.sent2: The predrying of the wood helped prevent warping during construction.
meanings.sent3: The predrying of the clay made the pottery class more efficient.
meanings.sent4: The predrying of the seeds ensured a successful germination process.
meanings.sent5: Proper predrying can save time and energy in the long run.
